position.marginalia_text: Licet hic hunc luna[e] ordine[m] animadvertere q[uod] planeta[e] vt ordine[m] se complectuntur, et sequitur mutuo ita hic desruptos esse serie co[n]tinuata. vt co[n]stituto semel exordio a &Mars; decano, quonia[m] hinc succidit &Sun;: solis proximus est positus decanus deinde &Venus;, tu[m] &Mercury; vltimo &Moon;: Trium ad Saturnu[m] reverti ordine[m] persequimur p[ri]ore.

marginalia.translation: Here it is allowed to estimate this succession of the moon, since the planets are themselves encompassed by this sucession, and it follows in return that thus they have been [...] by an unbroken succession. as constituted at the first beginning by Mars in the decan, because it was succeeded by the sun. The next decan is positioned in/by Venus, then Mercury and finally the moon.
What is the part of the sign.

underline.text: conati sunt disputationis attingere, in primis uestigiis constitutionis, istum tractatu[m], cum quodam dissimulationis fastidio reliquerunt
